children.subject: Campus repeat rules can be found here; http://registrar.berkeley.edu/academic-records/grades. For the minor, we don't have any more specific repeat rules.

Can we retake a lower-div CS course which is a requirement for the minor for a letter grade after taking it P/NP? If I P/NP CS 70 right now and P/NP it, can I retake it for a letter grade for the minor?
You should submit your application now. You should complete the completion form when you have the last class in process (during the summer)

Hi Nicole, 

Sure, that works.

Thank you for the response!

Just to confirm, I will be graduating over Summer 2018 and would have completed CS61A, CS61B, CS61C, CS70, CS188, CS170 and CS C100. 

I would complete CS61C over the summer and would have only completed 4 CS classes by the end of this semester. 

As such, I should be submitting my CS minor application during Summer 2018, am I right? 

Would really appreciate a response! 

Thank you so much for your help!

history.content:
Happy second week of the Spring semester! 
 
Due to changing campus policies, the CS minor process has been updated. 
In short, there will now be 2 processes required:
(1) submission of a declaration form once 4+ minor requirements have been completed :
(2) submission of a completion form when last requirement is in progress. 
For more info see: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor
If you've already completed the CS minor AND turned in "the old form" to us already, we'll process those as is, no need for the new forms.
Some of you turned in the old version of the form to declare the minor, you will later need to turn in a completion form upon completion of the minor.
history.subject: CS minor process updated
